Its a great place to be on a clear day, but really really annoying when the forecast is for a clear day, and you schlep yourself up here only to find out the fog has rolled in.

The views up here are AWESOME. You can see all of SF in its glory. Well you also see the dumpy aspects of it too, but screw those parts. Parking sucked (but that was expected). Its a great place for a tourist, or for after a date. 4.5 Stars, it just didn't blow me away like Crissy Field did.
author: Rocky K.

description: Great view from here but its insanely cold and windy, so bring a jacket. Usually plenty of free parking.  Worth visiting if you're a tourist or if you have tourists staying with you.  Make sure to go on a clear day.
author: Chad H.

description: Twin peaks is mostly hype, sure its a decent view...if you can find parking, its usually busy up there, I don't see how people can find it romantic, I prefer the view from Bernal Heights
author: Bruce W.

description: Stunningly gorgeous view.  Almost seems like you are looking down at a live map.  This is a must see for all your out of town guests.
author: Bleep S.

description:
Oooooh! Aaahhh!
So much  to drink in with your eyes.
But I got poison oak on the way down. We were hiking, and trying to do it off the beaten path. SO be careful, but don't let this scare you from climbing up there. Go now, night or day!
author: Matt L.

description:
Beautiful views that overlook San Francisco, and then some. Be warned though...unless you are coming up here around the end of August/beginning of September, you may want to bring a jacket, sweater or scarf....hell bring all 3. It gets pretty artic up there. Nevertheless, visit this place if you want an amazing view.

5 Big Red Ones.
author: James J.

description:
First off the view was gorgeous; definitely a spectacle to see if you're in the area.  I took my date here on Saturday night and we had fun--this was probably due to the fact that it was freezing and body heat was our best chance at survival.   

I would recommend going here with a date at night.  VERY INTERESTING!
author: Quanghuy L.

description:
Drive up to twin peaks,
 late one night, 
on a very foggy night,
and you will understand
how crazy mothers like david lynch think.
author: Gina B.

description: A great area to take a good look of the entire San Francisco.
author: Ronald N.

description: On a clear day, the view from Twin Peaks are breathtaking!  You can see all of San Francisco for miles.  Parking can take a few minutes, but despite the popularity of this place, parking is surprisingly manageable.  Be sure to check the weather before you go - it can get very cold and windy up there!
author: Aurora L.

description:
it's a great time to go here both during the day as well as after it's dark... just bring a jacket or something because it's normally windy and a bit chilly up here.
the view is worth it...
author: charlotte s.

description: My favorite place to go to on a warm summer night.  I would pickup ice-cream and sit and watch the pretty twinkling lights of the skyline. Priceless.
author: Jay A.

description: Ok, this is my second so-called exception to reviewing non-restaurant places.  Why?  Because I want to remind myself that I have to take all of my out-of-town visitors here because the view is just ridiculously breath-taking.  Also, Twin Peaks is another noteworthy addition to my "SF Favorites" yelp list.  Done deal.
author: Bert N.

description: A great place to take someone special. Been there three times and loved every moment. First time I ever saw San francisco from afar.
author: Diego O.

description: Beautiful views of San Francisco - and if its a clear sunny day, you can see everything...including the rolling fog that will inevitably roll in at one point during the day. :) Even if its hot and sunny down in...say, noe valley, its still WINDY as heck up near Twin Peaks. It may not be exactly cold, but expect high winds. omg, expect high winds...
author: Carol L.

description: As other people say, it's very cold there. But it's worth coming to have a very wide view of the city. A public restroom is also available there just in case. :)
author: David B.

description:
clearly its a great view, but like many local flavor hotspots my favorite part was the prime people watching opportunity. luckily i got to experience twin peaks for the first time during that random spurt of great january weather, so there were lots of people to observe who had the same idea that afternoon.

highlights:

- the surprising number of people who came up to take in the view parked in their car alone... including the man in a business suit enjoying his togo's sandwich
- the cyclist sitting on the ledge, stretching his arms all the way lengthwise taking in the great weather. he deserved the moment- its a tough ride up!
- the many lingering black crows
- this guy with his scooter that made way too much noise and disturbed the peace but you couldn't be annoyed because hey- its a scooter
- the double decker tourbus filled with excited, photo-happy SF tourists (which was the point we decided it was evidently time to take off)

love love love this city, and subsequently love taking in great views of it. minus one star for the tourbus.
author: Brianna H.

description:
one of the first dates I ever had up in SF...the thing is as the night progressed I became more and more uninterested her in a romantic fashion. after dinner she suggested that we go to twin peaks...I was like what is twin peaks....?

well she says there's a great view from up on high....
drove up the windy ass death defying roads....
in the fog.....
so after laughing in the face of death we finally reach the top....
and hung out....
hung out in the middle of the fog.......
just hangin out......
and hung out some more.....
in the fog. 

well, i finally feigned exhaustion and drove her back home....

otherwise I've been here on less fog filled nights and have to say that the view is amazing...don't let the rockin' cars bother you...they are just fighting over who gets to look out the window
;D
author: John-Michael C.

description: So I've been here both during the day and night. Both is a tad chilly. But I love it! The view is so BEAUTIFUL!!!!!! During the day, I enjoyed the very short hike to the top for the view. And at night, the city below is all lit up, I wish I had my camera that night! Plus, even when it's cold, it's a great date spot! I would highly recommend it! It's more than just a great view, it's an experience!
author: Megan L.

description: Maybe the best views in San Francisco, a city of views.  You can park or take the bus and hike up to the pinnacle for your very own living panorama.  For some reasons tourists go to all these other places in San Francisco, but few make it here to one of its best spots.  Maybe because there is nothing for sale.
author: Bob H.

description: Completely worthwhile and great view of SF.  I would include this on any visit to the city, even if you just stop for five minutes.  Plus, it's free.
author: I I.

description: Beautiful, Breath-Taking.  I had so much stress, but after seeing this all. My mind went blank.  I just couldnt even remember what i was stressin out about.. the scene was just unbelievable beautiful. Definitely coming back here again
author: Vivian L.

description: I love jogging up here from my apartment - the views are always a great reward after such a taxing climb.  The parking area tends to get very crowded on nice days, so try to get there early.  Also, be sure to hike up the actual peaks themselves instead of just hanging at the parking lot with the tourists - the views are a bit better, and it's a lot more quiet, especially on the peak furthest away from the parking lot.
author: Michael C.

description: On a night like tonight, this is why I love this city so much.  Perfect night time views of the city at its perfection.  Bay Bridge and Golden Gate Bridge, and the city in between.  For a city that costs so darn much to live in, the views up here are priceless.
author: Denise M.

description: Oh, I love this place. It is such a beautiful view! Was here on New Year's and could see the fireworks over near the Bay Bridge. At the top of the peaks, you can see 360 degrees around you. You can see both the bridges! It's gorgeous during the day and at night. Granted, some nights are so foggy you cant see where you're going. Some days and some nights are so windy you can hardly stand up straight. But pick a good weather day/night and it is GORGEOUS and well worth the trek up the hill. I'd recommend parking elsewhere and walking up to the peaks rather than going to the tourist-y overlook area where the parking lot and bathroom is. It's much more quiet and a better view from the top of the peaks! Of course, wouldn't recommend this at night, but it's a good day trek. A great place to go if you're from out of town or if you're a local!
author: Christine L.

description: Great Night Lights View, but make sure to check the weather. It is a good place to check out quickly for tourist, but not really a place to hang out. It can get very cold so as many have mentioned, BRING A JACKET. I also don't think it is very romantic. There are many people around so if you don't mind PDA go for it.
author: Jess H.

description:
the first time i went to twin peaks, i went with a boy who hit on me so blatantly and unexpectedly, i was stunned into giving him my number.  when we got there,  it made me think of inspiration point or blueberry hill.  i was an immigrant child and i learned english from american tv.  happy days was on all the time.

i wasn't sure about this boy for many reasons but it was a clear and warm summer night and we were looking out at the view when he said he wished it was colder so that i would move in closer.  i thought that was cute but then he asked me if i wanted a massage.  

strange question, i thought.  had i complained about a sore neck or back earlier?  did my muscles look tight?  i mean, he knew i worked at milano so did he think my body was sore from standing during my shift?  now i know better since i've heard that line from varying types of guys over the years.  really, the lack of originality is shocking.

anyway, twin peaks will always remind me of lovely night time views, funny guys from east oakland and the first massage i ever got.
author: Seong P.

description: I had lived in the area all my life but it took getting married and getting a set of in-laws to convince me up to the top here and have a look see.  My gods, what had I been doing with myself?  All the fantastic views of everything in the city and the bay right here at my feet and I hadn't even bothered to come up here?  It'll get crowded with the touristas but just find a space (or two wheel) and then hang out, hold your spot.  The busses are on a schedule so the tourists will come and go in waves, the dudes selling cut rate sweat shirts will come and go with them and in between you can block out all the noise and just be on top of the world for all you're concerned and soak it in.  If you can, do it with someone you love, or at least are in love with for that moment.  :-)
author: Rob M.

description: Why doesn't San Diego have a place like this? The only think I can think of is Cowles Mtn and that does not compare to Twin Peaks. The view from the top is AMAZING! My friends from SF took me up there a couple years ago when I was visiting during the summer and I was honestly taken away from the view. It's beautiful! I swear you can see all of SF! Only downside was that it was really, really, really cold! So even on a summer night, I'd say bring a jacket and enjoy the view :) I definitely can't wait to come here again, I need to drive to SF instead of flying so I can see more places.
author: Anna C.

description: Great views of the city, but so many tourists. Definitely a must for visiting friends. They also have a public toilet up here - do the doors have timers on them or what?
author: kathy c.

description: This place has some of the best views in San Francisco especially during a thunderstorm.  I have seen at least two storms from the top of Twin Peaks, and each one has been incredibly romantic.  Bring a loved one, park the car, and make out in the back seat.  It is like being in high school at lover's lane all over again--except this time you can actually be romantic not just horny hoping for a quick lay.
author: Jason W.

description: If you want a panoramic overlook of the great San Francisco city, this is the only place to be. I have yet to experience a sunset ti
author: Ryo S.

description: This is the best view of the entire city... whenever I take people here they are like WHOA.. amazing view.. go here when during sunset then wait a while until it gets dark and the city lights are like stars fallen from the sky.. sit there for a while and breath the air.. its fun to hang out here and talk and just enjoy the moment..
author: Faustino R.

description: I love Twin Peaks. The first time I went here was before when me and my boyfriend were just friends and he didn't drive yet and we were bored and no bus goes up there so we decided to walk up Twin Peaks. It is really worth the walk! I wouldn't walk there during night though but I went again last night but this time my boyfriend drove up there. Even though I'm a native San Franciscan and was born and raised here for the eighteen years of my life, I've only gone to this beautiful view twice and I still enjoy it. It's definitely a good place to sightsee whether it's day or night, it's still beautiful either way. :)
author: Jessica R.

description: It's hit-and-miss and as confusing as the San Francisco weather.  The views vary with the weather.  On clear nights, it's really beautiful!  On foggy nights, it's eh. Sometimes people just sit in their cars to look out, on cold days. Despite the weather, it always seems like a go-to destination for couples.  I can speak from experience.  It's also a great place to hang out with friends or to meet new ones.  Nothing is as great as smoking hookah on top of one of the garbage cans of Twin Peaks on a clear night.  NOTHING!  Well, nothing that I've experienced yet.  The twisty roads are fun for those car enthusiasts that like to drift up the mountains Initial D-style.  Just don't get into an accident.  It's one of the must-see places.  I usually go at night, but my day experiences have been pretty spectacular themselves.  I like to go to Ike's place for a sandwich and driving to this not-so-far away location to savor the sandwich and the sights.
author: Brandon Y.

description: Absolutely beautiful!  Gotta go on a clear day.  I've never been at night, but I hear it's just as great.  A great place to take someone special.  It is incredibly windy all the time there though, so take a jacket.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: Perfect use of a stale sick day. Twin Peaks, on a clear San Francisco day, is THE place to be.  Hike for a couple of hours, I promise you won't get too winded. Then relish the views atop the ubiquitous Twin Peaks once you've made it.  Don't forget your camera, because the views are simply breathtaking. The air is a bit more chilli up there, but that's what sweaters are for, remember. If you're feeling adventurous and extra energetic, you can walk to West Portal and watch a movie.  Or if you feeling like Super Iron Person, walk to the Glen Park BART station, don't worry it's all downhill, and start another adventure in its entirety.
author: brenda b.

description:
oy vey, the fugging graffiti is horrendous, but the spectacular views made me overlook the "urban art." I swear, elect me mayor and I will have every tagger's limbs cut off at the elbow. don't flame me, I will block you and have you TOSsed :-P

can't decide whether I like the view from Noe peak or Eureka peak better. what ? you didn't know the Twin Peaks had names ? what kind of self-respecting San Franciscan are you ? tsk tsk tsk.

fyi: Noe is the peak that looks over Noe Valley; Eureka peak looks over Eureka Valley (that's the Castro to you noobs)
author: Prima D.

description:
just reading those reviews takes me back!!!! i remember all the times i went up there with guys with whoms hearts i would soon break.... first time i went up there was with sf natives and a group of my girls. we bet $10 that it would still be foggy when we go to the top. thats 10 bucks ill never see again. it was soo nice to look over the fog and see the towers of the golden gate bridge and that top of the skyscrapers blanketed in glowing fog....its a one of a kind sight. ive been up there soo many times that when i see peoples pics looking down on market street i know exactly where they were standing for the shot. 

one of the reasons why sf is soooo great!!!
author: Ashley H.

description: A great start for people visiting the city for the first time.  Amazing view from the top of Twin Peaks.  You can see all the way from the Golden Gate around to the Bay Bridge and then all the way past Daly city.  Only thing that's bad is sometime it can get REAL chilly and windy up there.  Bring a winter jacket!
author: Mitch A.

description:
fecund gestures of seduction  par excellance fom mistrss san francisco. billowing kisses of fog scented by pacific ocean convection.
home, sweet home, inhale the nirvana. asana moves upward dog.
author: miriam b.

description:
great view, overcrowded parking lots, so never drive up here. 
walk to the top of the peaks and get a better view of market street. 
at night, twin peaks gets even better... views and the stars are illuminated.

only bus accessible to twin peaks is the 36 teresita. get off at the marview stop. then walk, walk, and walk up the hill. 
oh, and call 311 to make sure your 36 comes as the 36 comes every so often.
author: Court L.

description: This is the most spectacular view in San Francisco. You can see the entire city from there. Just make sure it's not foggy. If they had a bar up here, it'd be perfect.
author: Srinivas R.

description:
When visiting Twin Peaks, your challenge - should you choose to accept it - is to beat the fog. For this mission you will require a hat that won't fly off your head as to avoid the Einstein look from the wind. If you're a guy and you want the girl you're with to have a straight outta Titanic "Oh Leo" kind of moment, make sure you bring a good coat and plan on giving it to the girl. In fact, maybe you should wear a sweater underneath. Bonus chivarly points if you then put your arms around her to keep her warm. Don't be a jerk about it and try to grab her boob though unless you've been dating for awhile and you know she'll laugh. This is chivalry 101. 
--
We went up here on a clear day when the BF was trying to impress me and managed to get there around 4, just in time to see the fog roll in over the city and completely cover the whole view. It was a view unto itself to see nothing but the tops of skyscrapers poking through the fog. A true SF experience for a girl who had just moved there a few weeks earlier. Good place to snag a kiss or at the very least, a few souvenir photographs.
author: Kat E.

description: If there's ever any doubt that you're in the most beautiful city in America, take a drive (and a jacket) up to Twin Peaks.  San Francisco is beautiful under the sunshine, beautiful at sunset and beautiful lit up at night.  This is a great place to see it all.
author: P J.

description: Great for motorcycling or impressing that special someone, or for pretending that gazing into a skyscraper-filled future or electrical net (depending on your current body chemistry) . Head up past the areolae of the peaks to experience the chilling wind at full capacity. Nowhere in the city can you stand so diagonally without falling over!
author: T.Z. R.

description:
Circa 1988:

Me, Diana, Robin, Julie and Gina meet Jonathan, Tarik, Herman and his friend Herman and drive up to Twin Peaks.  We park our cars  along some area of the rough terrain...get out...mix our rum and coke and chase it with Cisco or Old E!  We sit on the rocks laughing and talking all-the-while mesmerized by the lights and movement of "The City".  Some of us couple off ...hop back in our cars where we remain mesmerized until the sun comes up!

Circa 2008

Tarik the kids and I can't sleep!  It's too damn hot!  We live in San Francisco and have no air conditioning!

Me:  babe let's go to Twin Peaks!
T:  You're joking right?  It's 11 pm.  We can't take the kids up there at this hour!
Me:  Old foggy!  Why not...It's freakin' hot and the kids won't go to sleep...at least there is AC up there.
T:  You're trippin...whatever.

We drive to Twin Peaks on this steamy SF night with the kids in tow!  It's beautiful!  It's breezy and the kids have a blast.  The memories of our many 80's adventures come flooding back.  We go home and mommy and Tarik make happy again!   ...teeheeheee

It's nice to know that even middle-aged San Francisco natives can still have a late night rendezvous at Twin Peaks!
author: Karla F.

description:
this place is a scary drive especially on a foggy night
but on nights when its clear, which is rare after the summer, its a nice place to go to except there's always people drinking here on friday nights and there's people having sex as if they're homeless and have no houses but hey i guess it's exciting for them.

besides that, the view here is amazing, just try not to get lost going down since there are two ways to get up there
author: Kenny L.

description: What better way is there to see the view of the city.  While I tend to sometimes get nervous at high altitudes, the view was so breathtaking that it takes your mind off of everything else.  I made sure not to make any sudden movements, I just held on to my boo and took in the amazing city.  We got there a little too late and missed the sunset which was our original reason for going, but we still managed to get some amazing pictures and we will certainly be back.
author: Alana A.

description: Favorite vantage point, especially on a clear night.  If the party bus isn't there (I think it leaves after 11pm), you might feel like it's just you and the city lights.
author: Tim T.

description: If you go at night, BRING A JACKET. It's windy and cold. Bring a camera too because nice pictures can be taken from this vantage point. Even though I'm a local, this is probably one of two places (the other being Ocean Beach) that I like going to when I need some time for introspection or when I just want to take in the beauty of the city lights of San Francisco at night. I could just sit here all night until sunrise and just look and the city scape. It's also a great place to bring visitors who haven't been to the city before. You can practically see the entire city in one shot from here. One time I went here with someone and saw a shooting star when I was staring at the sky. Just a special moment I had over here. Whenever I'm here, I'm reminded of the Red Hot Chili Peppers song "Under The Bridge" every time I go here despite the fact that the lead singer mentions "city of angels". Bleh it should be "City By the Bay".
author: Gerard Y.

description: This place is sure beautiful at night when it isn't foggy. But this place sure is a scary drive. And people like to shoot other people here, so 4 stars it is.
author: Elaine H.

description: Definitely and must-see for anyone who is visiting San Francisco or has forgotten why this city is so freaking awesome!  It can be hard to find if you don't know the way, just take a turn up the hill at "Twin Peaks" gas station at the top of Upper Market and Portola.
author: Bruce R.

description: Great place to go when you are in the city. I went here once at night time and once in the day time, and both times I got to see fantastic views of San Francisco. The drive up is quite nice also.. not too long or windy, but relaxing.. nice place to cuddle up with your sweetie. :)
author: Orie M.

description: The view is beautiful here on clear days . You can't see anything on foggy days so make sure it's a good day before you go up there . The drive up & down is pretty scary . There's two ways to get up there .. I think one entrance is at Clayton St. or something and one is at Portola ( across from SOTA ) .
author: Eileen L.

description: Simply great. Don't forget to hike up the actual peaks for the best views.
author: Mike O.

description: Superb view of the city and surrounding water. Great for pictures, hiking, biking, possibly making out. Lots of parking. I went up on a motorcycle, so you see a lot more. Breath taking. Try to go on a clear day or close to sunset.
author: Mindy L.

description: We came at night and it was freezing but an awesome place! I'm glad that we went at night because it was so much prettier than morning with nyc-like night view. the clouds were right above our heads flying by quick which created beautiful pictures - but it was COLD! go at night, wear thick layers, and you won't regret it.
author: Y L.

description: One of my favorite places to take out-of-town guests, Twin Peaks is the ultimate cool destination.  It can be fun to watch the fog rolling in, but the best is a clear night when you get a great view.  It's off-limits to tour groups because you have to go through some residential areas to access it, so it's not too crowded.  There's a nice map on the side of the bathroom, too, so you can figure out what you're looking at.
author: Roger L.

description:
An EXPERIENCE: The back road from Twin Peaks to Haight Ashbury!  This is strictly for SF visitors, in that, of course, all SF residents already know about this.
A while back, I was driving limousines and, of course, Twin Peaks was one of the most popular scenic destinations for SF visitors, both day and night, as well as, especially, limousine 'parties', for Bay Area residents and others, who were celebrating whatever the 'occasion-for-the-limousine' might be!
Usually, like most limousine driver-escorts-tourguides, I would drive up Market Street to Portola Drive, allowing the 'parties/party' in the rear of the limousine, to view the 'grandeur' of San Francisco, as Market Street rises slowly and windingly, from the 'intenseness' of downtown San Francisco, to the 'heights' of the San Francisco Twin-Peak Hills.  From Portola Drive, I'd then turn onto Twin Peaks Boulevard and let the 'visitors/party' in the limo, further enjoy the scenery, as I somewhat slowly ascended to the final parking areas at the top of Twin Peaks, where the limo-party could get out and look around for however long they desired.
Usually then, most limousine/bus tourguides, retrace their path-to-the-top-of-Twin Peaks, returning down to Portola/Market, to continue on from there.  However, quite often I would, instead, exit Twin Peaks by taking the 'back road', down into the Haight-Ashbury.  This means continuing on Twin Peaks Boulevard, down to Clayton Street, crossing 17th Street and then taking Ashbury Street off of Clayton.
This is where my particular 'Experience' occurred, that I am relating here!
At this point, of our descent-into-Haight/Ashbury, at about Ashbury and Waller Streets, I would usually pick up my microphone to address the 'party-in-the-rear', with the following 'tour-guide-announcement': "Ladies and Gentlemen, we are are now approaching one of the most famous locations in the City of San Francisco.  Just ahead, at the very next intersection, is that famous street-sign, that says, 'Haight/Ashbury'!"
Well, as it just happened to be, the 'party' in the rear of my limo that day, was a group of teenagers who were celebrating the birthday of one of their group and were doing so in my limo.  But, it was still somewhat surprising to me, when, after my afore-given 'announcement', I just happened to hear, just barely through the glass-window-separator between the Driver and Passenger compartments, which was about half-way-down anyway, one of the kids in the rear, who turned to his companions and asked the very question that had surprised me so much: "Hey, Dudes!  What is Haight/Ashbury?"
author: Nelson R.

description: Amazing views of the city.  We went up around 3:00 or 3:30 on a week day and it was pretty empty up there.  You can get some great photos up here.  I'd imagine some amazing sunsets, so bring your tripod if you're into photography!
author: R R.

description: Bad Memories here. Kind of gloomy, but when the sun comes out it can be nice.
author: Alexandra G.

description: On those rare, warm and sunny days in the city, it's hard to beat rolling into the parking lot, leaning on the hood of your car just so, and popping-top on a master-cylinder of Sapporo. One of the few occasions outside of adolescence where you feel cooler than everyone because you brought beer.
author: Big S.

description: Of all the touristy stuff to do in SF, twin peaks is easily my favorite. The view, whether at day or night, is simply amazing (as long as the fog doesn't ruin things). The spot is hardly an unknown commodity, but both times I've gone there was plenty of space to enjoy the sights without feeling cramped. Just be sure to bring warm clothing, as the combination of altitude, wind, and proximity to the ocean can make twin peaks very cold at times.
author: Byron C.

description: Yes, good old twin peaks.  I love the roads leading up to it especially when it turns into a one way, nice and slippery, amateurs be careful, actually dont drive or ride hard up there cause there are them pesky bicyclists ya gotta watch out for.  The lot up there is pretty tight, but its usually packed on those nice nights, but there are little lots on the road down on every side so you can still get your views in.  Oh yeah if you see cars rockin or cars with steamed windows, dont bother em.  Or if youre into it, fuck with em, tell em to get a room or share their weed.  A very far second favorite of mine compared to Mt Tamalpais,  sorry frisconeezers, I still claim marin.  hahaha. shit.
author: Hen A.

description:
I love Twin Peaks. By that I mean non tourist peak where you can actually sit down on a rock and enjoy a panorama view which you cannot seeat the tourist peak! 
It is mesmerizing the ocean, the bridge, the hills, the bay, downtown you see everything you like about the city by turning around once.
It can get a little windy up there so bring a jacket but if you jogg up there (like I do) from Noe Valley, once you overcome the zillion little stairs beginning at Grand View  you ll be lucky to have some wind blow dry you :)
I love coming there with my neighbor's dog as she drags me to keep going ;-) 
If you want to take picture of you with downtown in the background I recommend joining the tourists as you can have beter pictures there.
author: Natascha P.

description: Best 360 degree view of San Francisco, hands down.  Absolutely beautiful, a must see!
author: Matt W.

description: Most beautiful views ever. Day or night.  Reminds me of why I love SF :)
author: Jasleen D.

description: Absolutely great view of the whole city. Only one other car there, but I guess it's not tourist season yet. Fog starts rolling in around 3 and you can't see anything from the very top, but there's still a good view right where the houses stop. Definitely bring a jacket.
author: Joyce C.

description: Quintessential SF views, a must for out of town guests. Beware, it's always windy and cold.
author: Michelle S.

description: This is by far the BEST view of San Francisco.  Every time I have a visitor in town I take them for a drive up to this peak.  It is always windy and cooler on top of the lookout, but the pictures are priceless!  On any given day I enjoy driving up to the top and taking in the view, it is soothing and relaxing (despite the bus loads of tourists).  The view truly brings out the beauty of the city from the Bay Bridge all the way to the Golden Gate.. the view puts things in perspective for me and I always realize that I am lucky to be living in San Francisco!
author: Michelle N.

description: I've ben going to this bar since 1997( wwhen I was 37, now I'm 50),when I took a trip to SF with a freind.the location is great,the drinks are strong and well-mixed. the music isn't too loud,one can actually have a conversation,yes it is an older crowd that is friendly and intelegent. I have met some amicable people there and always have  a pleasant time. I cannot wait to visit again,and see my beloved SF!!"I left my heart in San Francisco"
author: Alexander W.

description: I have never seen a picnic set up there because it can be cold and windy but it's worth the temperature shock to take in the most amazing view of our Fair City.  In clear times it is beautiful.  If you can catch it just right, the occasional low-lying fog bank can be a treat.  When it is just the right depth it gives the optical illusion that there is a giant blanket wrapping the city floor below.. all the lights illuminating the fog give it an interesting warm glow.
author: Jim W.

description: Who likes great scenery of the city at night? ::raises hand:: I do, I do.
author: Sonlay V.

description: What a beautiful view of the Bay Area.  This is one of those tourist landmarks that you've gotta appreciate even if you live here and it never old whether you're taking out-of-towners on a tour of the town, or if you're just chillin' and chattin' with a friend on the hill past midnight.  I have the feeling that I really don't have to review this place, there are enough solid reviews on here, and if you know San Francisco, you've been to Twin Peaks.  But for whatever reason, if anybody hasn't heard about it and you're in town, take the drive up on a warm night, park your car, and take in The City.
author: Tony L.

description: Only Mountain in SF, one of the most sensational and exceptional view of the city. Don't forget to bring your jacket!
author: Stanley K.

description: Oh, memories of high school days...rather a night or two.  It's a shame to forget the beautiful sites and greatness that the city has to offer.  This is one of them.  The view from above is unmatchable.  Be sure to take Portola back down to get the full appreciation and awe of this area in the city, it's incredible!
author: ERICA E.

description: 360 degree views of San Francisco! How can you beat that! Be prepared, its windy up there! There are also trails up to the top of the peaks . . Leave the tourists behind, cross the street and trek on up those peaks. Enjoy!
author: Judy L.

description: Walk, i know its hard, but its so worth it.  Grab a water bottle and just start walking, you might ache, but the expereince it so worth it.
author: Herbert S.

description: When me and my girlfriend had taken a trip to the bay and stopped by twin peaks it had to been one of the best views i have ever seen. You really have to come up here on a good day where weather's good or else you won't enjoy the view as much.
author: Jerald S.

description: Definitely worth the trip.  We happened to go on a sunny day with clear skies, so we were lucky.  Great view of SF and the Golden Gate Bridge
author: Jacob S.

description: One of my favorite spots in San Francisco, esp at night.  Take someone up there for the first time, and they will never forget it.  Awesome.
author: George M.

description: Despite the fact that this is the first place the fog hits, it's one of the greatest views in town. Good place for a challenging bike ride. I like trying to pinpoint my favorite places from Twin Peaks. Everyone says it's an exhibitionist's dream, but sadly I've never had the pleasure of making out up there....yet.
author: Colleen B.

description: A high school friend drove us up here for the beautiful view.  It feels good to look over the city at night but it was cold and windy.  It would have been more awesome during a lunar eclipse even though there might be too much light pollution.  The lights are pretty but not sprawling.  When I travel, I like to climb to a height to see the city plan.
author: Ai M.

description: My dad is from SF, and chooses to have a place in Twin Peaks, vs all the rest of the awesome areas of the city, for one reason: the view!  Personally I'd rather live IN the city rather than have a view of it (although yes, it is 'in' the city..), and having rented from them years ago i can vouch that its a pain in the ass to get to on a daily basis, but if a visitor looking for a good view of SF, its hard to beat! also, the safeway up there is probably my favorite in the city (not crowded, parking etc)! i wouldnt leave your car up here though as my parents minivan (yes, minivan) was stolen parked on the street (which can happen anywhere i suppose, but the minivan was hardly theft quality)...also ive seen a bus take off the back end of a vehicle on the windy streets up here without any concern..
author: Danielle J.

description: Best sweeping view of the city, hands down. But don't go too early in the morning or too late in the afternoon because it gets foggy up there! Bring a jacket, it gets cold.
author: Chris S.

description: Whenever anyone visits me from out of town, I try to take them here first to give them a sense of the city.  From this vantage point, SF is like a 3-D map, all laid out before you.
author: Pelle Y.

description: I've been up here a 100 times over the years and it never disappoints. Even when a caravan of secret service types and their foreign dignitary guardees block the road for 20 minutes and keep everyone who's in, in and everyone still on the hill, out. But hey, at least I know I'm bringing my out-of-towners to same hot spots as the fancy politicos.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Haha. Um, well, I really like this place. Simply beautiful.. and I totally echo what some of you are saying - if there's even a sign of fog in sight, don't go, for it's incredibly difficult to see while driving to the top.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Even though I came here alot when I was a kid, it never really looked as pretty from up there until i went there recently.. maybe it was more romantic because I was with my SO.. imma sucker for romantic stuff. The view was BEAUTIFUL on a clear, sunny.. alittle bit windy day!
author: christy w.

description: My boyfriend and I actually jogged up to Twin Peaks on a cloudy, windy and chilly morning. BUT it's was worth it . I mean the view is spectacular, non like this you can find in NY. Definitely a MUST visit when in San Fran. Just simply beautiful.
author: tanty d.

description: Clear day, blue sky and a nice cool breeze.  Standing at the top looking down at SF.  Priceless.   Just can't beat a better view of the city from that vantage point.  It brought a calm inside my mind and body.  Wow.  Just go check it out folks.
author: Goose C.

description:
If you have more than one day in SF, then I recommend taking the time to walk to the top of Twin Peaks, either from the Castro muni stop or even 16th & Mission BART station. As long as it isn't foggy, it's gosh-darn easy to figure out where you should be walking as you can see it! The thing is, even if you don't go all the way up to hang out with the crowds who drove to the top, you will still have found yourself a fetching view of SF, the hills and the bay to the east.


 You also get to walk past lots of victorian houses in the quaint SF style. It's a very safe neighborhood to wander in, and if you're lucky, you might come across some of the secret stairs.


 Give yourself 2 hours to get to the top, 1 hr to get down. Word of warning, when you get to the base of the parkland, you'll have to spend a while walking either north or south (mostly flat, along the contour line) to get to the road that leads you to the entrance to the car parking area and viewing platform.
author: CarrotRabbit

description: Come here at dawn and watch the the Bay Bridge spray commuters into the city. The best view of San Francisco, not to be missed.
author: Geronimo G.

description: Twin Peaks has the most amazing view of the city, ever.  As a local, I enjoy going there on a regular basis.  I usually take everyone that visits SF there.  The one thing though, as has been mentioned in many reviews, beat the fog!  If there is fog, turn around and go home.  You won't see anything.  But on a clear day, go, take some friends, sit down and enjoy the view.
author: Meghana A.

description: Didn't know about this place until we arrived in San Francisco. We had a car so it was easy to get to for us. My advice is don't leave the city without visiting it. The view is magnificent and it's so peaceful.
author: Kellemar

description: The view from Twin Peaks is amazing! It's a definite must-see when you're in San Francisco. I've gone up there for the 4th of July a few times to watch the fireworks display. It's definitely the best spot in the city to watch the fireworks and is surprisingly not too crowded either.
author: michelyn

description: the view there can be only described in one word- amazing. is a must go in San Francisco. The Muni Metro Twin Peaks Tunnel runs beneath the Twin Peaks, linking Downtown San Francisco with West Portal and the southwestern part of the city. There is no public transportation service directly to the summit of the peaks, but the 37 Corbett Muni line stops near a path that goes up the hills on Crestline Drive.
author: moonight

description: It's always cold over there, but hey what a place for a first kiss, day or night this place is one of my favorite spots.
author: dim l.

description: It's great to come up here and get a different perspective on the city - plus it's so far away from anything that by the time the cops arrive you can be long gone...
author: Quartknee K.

description: With its panoramic views, Twin Peaks is breathtaking.  During the day the city is laid out before you from the Mission to the Marina, so its no wonder that the tourists flock here.  Go there at night to see the lights of the city sparkling up at you and if you're lucky enough to go there during New Year's its a fantastic spot to watch the fireworks. Although I love the gorgeous views of the Bay from Sausalito, despite all the tourists Twin Peaks has a hushed quality about it that makes you feel like its the first time you've seen the beauty of San Francisco.
author: C C.

description: not to be confused with the david lynch series 'twin peaks'.... (although a great show/& movie and i briefly had one of sherilyn fenns brothers as a roommate... but thats a whole other story) sorry, i was A.D.D.'ing for a second. anyway, twin peaks is one of those great san francisco spots that can truly take your breath away. being a native, i had been all over this city, except for twin peaks. strangely enough, a friend of mine from the east coast dragged me up here to see what i was missing. wow, you can see all of san francisco from up here from the west looking east. its even more pretty at night when all the lights are glittering below you. whether the occasion is... romantic, therapeutic, scenic, touristy or otherwise.... one thing remains the same, its one of the best places to view our fabulous city. almost magical. well, depending upon who you're standing up there with i guess.
author: Michelle I.

description: beautiful views, nippy winds, and less than 10minutes from home...what more could i ask for?
author: Roshni R.

description: a great make-out place with amazing view of the city.
author: Nelle A.

description: I have even been taken here in my dreams - THE view of San Francisco followed by 2. from Dolores Park and 3. from DeYoung Observation Tower
author: Samuel A.

description: i'm so happy that when i searched for the most-reviewed places on yelp in san francisco before my visit in april, twin peaks came up first! what else can i say that other people haven't said already? great view, a little cold, but a total san francisco moment and it really put the city into perspective. thanks, yelpers, for a great suggestion!
author: Laura A.

description: this place has a terrific view.  but after living in san francisco for all twenty two years of my being, it gets old.  what was once a tourist hot spot, is now a favorite smokespot for the locals.  i'm over it.
author: rachface -.

description: great views!  and it's a great place to have that "first kiss!"  but it's always cold up there...
author: C J.

description: best view of the city.  bring a jacket, unless you like freezing to death.  oh and if you go there at night, you will be surrounded by druggies and sexual exhibitionists, but they don't mean harm.
author: Ray R.

description: especially on two wheels, the winding roads that lead to the top of Twin Peaks can be as fun as the views afforded once you get there.  wonderful panoramic views of our beautiful city radiate from every angle, with quarter operated telescopes a fun option to find your flat or your ex's house.  the bastard.  anyway going to the top of Twin Peaks seems like one of those "going to Alacatraz" things that you only do when out-of-town friends arrive and you wanna show off the gorgeous city you live in, and once there you think "God, I never come up here...it's beautiful!"  a great place to go  on a date, maybe before dinner or after a movie, to talk and watch dusk fall and the city lights turn on and it's free!  it's fun! it's pretty!  it'd be almost like a lover's lane if not for the tour buses full of tourists watching you make out, but if you're into exhibitionism, it's THE place to go!
author: church B.

description: Nice view of Golden gate bridge, San Francisco and bay bridge!!
author: RO Z.

description: best FRONT SEAT and back seat make out spot ever. "cupcake" (i just learned the term) or share a cupcake with your hot date as you admire the sparkling city lights of san francisco on a clear night. romance.... *sigh*
author: Alex D.

description: Absolutely gorgeous view!  I can say with certainty that I have never seen a more lovely night view in my entire lifetime; of course that shows you how little I have seen in this world, but you know, it takes time!  Our friends took us there like the tourists we are, and we were all wondering whether or not it was going to be so foggy, because we weren't too optimistic when we were nearing the base...but as we drove up, we found out it was pretty clear, and we called that "beginner's luck."  Hehehe.  It was worth it.  =)  I also liked that there was no wall in the way, and you could just sit there on the ledge and take it all in...great great view!  I would go again, but I don't know if we will be so lucky next time!
author: W W.

description:
i don't think it gets any better than this.

if you like san francisco, you will love twin peaks.
author: Kerry N.

description: Everytime I have guests that aren't from the Bay, I take them to Twin Peaks.  This place is gorgeous.  You can see the entire Bay Area from here!  My only gripe is that it's really, really, windy and the restrooms never work.  But it's so worth it for the view!  Just make sure you pee before you get there!
author: Charlene R.

description: we went on a super clear night and the views were insane.  happy times.
author: ML ..

description: never thought of this place until a friend of mine mentioned it.  must visit this location at night.  free parking.  very cold, so bring a jacket.  the view is breathtaking.  i cannot see anyone giving this place less than four stars unless they fell off the ridge.
author: Bryce K.

description: dope view. easy to get lost in. fun fun fun
author: Angelo M.
